channel.title: How do i take a screen shot in Xubuntu?
channel.description: does anyone know? when i press prnt screen, and go to gimp, and press ctrl+v or click paste, it doesn't paste my desktop.

item.title: How do i take a screen shot in Xubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @deoxys505 deoxys505
item.description:
@deoxys505 wrote:

ok…right now i like the feel of Xubuntu and the look, but until i get more used to linux, i’m not planning on switching, besides, i like to be different…thats why i use this system…

i’ll keep googling my question tho…

Read full topic
item.source: How do i take a screen shot in Xubuntu?

item.title: How do i take a screen shot in Xubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“deoxys505, post:3, topic:95085”]I’ve gone through way more than i can take in installing Xubuntu, and i don’t like the way Kubuntu looks, but if anyone could help, i would be thankful…I’ll start googling now, just thought i’d ask you guys first…

also how do i run terminal or whatever it’s called, i need to install flash 7 for some websites to work…[/quote]

I suggest you just try Kubuntu, you never know, you might like it. You can change the skin as well, it’s easier to use and easier to get used to.

Just do some google searches for “installing flash” +xubuntu(Everything in the asterisks).

Read full topic

item.title: How do i take a screen shot in Xubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

In Kubuntu, all I need to do is press the prnt screen button and a window pops up asking me what to do.
